conclusion: A uniform electric field is formed between two parallel metal plates A and B carrying opposite charges.
An electron is injected into the electric field along the central line perpendicular to the direction of the electric field with an initial velocity v0 = 4 × 10^6 m/s from point O.
When the electron exits the electric field at point C on the right edge, its velocity direction forms a 30° angle with the direction of v0.
The charge of the electron is e = 1.6 × 10^-19 C, and the mass of the electron is m = 0.91 × 10^-30 kg.
The task is to find the kinetic energy of the electron at point C in J.

The image depicts an electron injected into a uniform electric field between two parallel metal plates, starting at point O with initial velocity v0 and exiting at point C with a velocity forming a 30° angle with the original direction.
The electron's initial velocity is v0 = 4 × 10^6 m/s.
After exiting the electric field at point C, the electron's velocity forms a 30° angle with the original direction.
The electric field causes a change in velocity direction, but the magnitude of v0 remains constant due to conservation of energy.
The electron's kinetic energy at O is given by KE_O = 1/2 mv0^2.
Since the magnitude of the velocity remains unchanged, the kinetic energy at point C is also 0.3648 J.
The kinetic energy of the electron at point C is 0.3648 J.
